snippet: An independent review recommended holding peacekeeping soldiers more accountable for sexual abuse and other crimes, and urged that they no longer be used in counterterrorism operations.
abstract: Independent panel appointed by United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon to evaluate structure and performance of UN peacekeeping operations recommends holding soldiers more accountable for sexual abuse and other crimes; also urges they no longer be used in counterterrorism deployments.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and RICK GLADSTONE

lead_paragraph: An independent review recommended holding peacekeeping soldiers more accountable for sexual abuse and other crimes, and urged that they no longer be used in counterterrorism operations.

headline.main: Panel Urges Changes in Using U.N. Soldiers
headline.print_headline: Panel Urges Changes in Using U.N. Soldiers
